THIS GAME HAS PORTALS
Very, Very Fun Game!

If you have not played Portal 1 and/or it's sequel you are missing out on HOURS of thought provoking yet incredibly fun puzzles, character and worldbuilding that stands on its own(i didnt even know this was in the same universe as half life until years after I played Portal 2), a fantastic sense of humor, and a villain that is terrifying yet sympathetic.

Probably my favourite game ever. The circumstances of the game's conception, the uniqueness of the game's core mechanic, the insight into the beta version of this game. The game's atmosphere, music, storyline, details hidden in the little nooks and crannies. All these factors create such a powerful experience for me.
jogo incrível, só isso mesmo

gameing
top :)

[h1]The cake is a lie[/h1]

Primera vez que juego algo de Valve y sinceramente salí muy a gusto. Un juego que te podés pasar en una sentada y bastante entretenido [strike]especialmente por GladOS[/strike]. Sin duda es un must-have que todo jugador de PC debe tener (si sos de Argentina sale 12 pesitos, ni para un alfajor futbolito te alcanza eso, no seas ratón).

A pesar de tener puzzles a resolver no son nada complicados en su mayoría, aunque dominar las mecánicas de juegos es muy gratificante, especialmente para speedruns. Este aspecto es clave ya que permite una experiencia tanto para personas no muy dadas al gaming como para gente que lleva años jugando.

Más allá no tengo más para decir, cuando juegue más de esta empresa tal vez lo rejuegue y haga un análisis profundo. Por ahora lo dejamos como una reseña-opinión

Nota final: 9.5/10
Corto y entretenido, con una historia oculta que me gusto, si tienen la oportunidad comprenlo.

This piece of art does cost some money, but i can assure you: this is definitely worth the cost. i won't spoil any of the story (and you can be sure that the story is very immersive), but i will explain the basic core gameplay.
The game is a non-euclidean physics game. which, in simpler words means: in a euclidean world the shortest way to travel between point A and B is a strait line, like in 2D worlds and in the real world (sometimes), ans a non-euclidean world defies that. which means... you can travel, for example: from one end of your room the fastest by walking right instead of straight. the way this game implements it is portals (as the name suggests). the portals connect the 2 locations they are placed in, and makes a window which you can see through and watch what your camera would see if it was in that location. is you want to understand how the portals work then read the rest, if else than start downloading now instead of later! 



a portal is nothing but a class which contain several variables: position, orientation, color,  the other camera data*, player position data (I think it is stored there) and some other optimization stuff. the position is used to determine collisions, and rendering. the orientation is used to render and to help make the collisions more precise.

*both portals have cameras storing the live visuals of the visible portion of the portal output (using the player position data they received from the other portal they can determine the visibility) which they send to the other portal to project, which makes an illusion of a window that opens to a spot that isn't behind the wall, a portal. but that's just the projection, right now with these processes you can only look through it and not walk into it. the teleportation is a lot simpler, its in the name. the game doesn't generate infinite rooms when you fall through the floor and exit through the ceiling, that will kill your computer in no-time. instead, the portals take your current coordinates during the collision, compares them to the portal orientation and position, sends them as offset to the second portal, and the second portal compares them to the world, which means, you go in a corner of a portal, you come out in the same corner of the portal, but in the other portal's coordinates.

all of this comment seems very complicated and chunky. but trust me, its just teleportation engineering!

thanks a lot to you if you enjoyed reading my comment and hope you purchased the game, if you want a simpler and more compact explanation in voice, ill recommend checking out those videos: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kEB11PQ9Eo8  ,  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EMKLeS-Uq_8&list=PLh9DXIT3m6N4qJK9GKQB3yk61tVe6qJvA

This is one of my favorite games!  It has lots of puzzles ( which i like ) And good Physics. Some of the Test Chambers are really tricky to get through.

I played this game a few times but im finally doing a review:

Graphics: Far from  its time
Story: Everything seems nice and normal at first , you play a lab-rat type of puzzle game assisted by a passive-aggressive , as you are going throughout the white-mate , clean test chambers you see a misplaced piece of wall , you enter in out of curiosity , and you shockingly see the incoherent writings of a mad-man on the industrial rust , strange messages and symbols such as "The cake is a lie" . You nope out of there immediately and return to your test chamber. After this experience you (the player) is concerned with his safety and sweet reward that is promised to you by the GLaDOS throughout the levels.You start to wonder why you never seen or heard a human being yet then it hits you. GLaDOS senses you realize what is happening and tries to prolong your "testing" and even tries to get rid of you. You escape in the end after defeating her.

Boss(GLaDOS): As you try to escape the facility you run into her control room and tries to poison you with toxic gas. Her design was actually more horrifying than expected , altho fairly eloquent in design , her overall design , a loose limb hanging from the ceiling with one eye and orbs hanging to her sides is reminiscent of an eldritch monster. The boss fight (and the game itself) is rather short , but fun.

Rating: 97/100
